clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot RCT Comparing Effectiveness of Two Decision Aids for Hip and Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot RCT Comparing Effectiveness of Two Decision Aids for Hip and Knee Osteoarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: This pilot RCT study is to examine the comparative effectiveness of two decision aids for hip and knee osteoarthritis.

detailed_description.textblock: This pilot RCT study is to examine the comparative effectiveness of two decision aids for hip and knee osteoarthritis. The vendors employ different design features (e.g. use of video for patient narratives, interactive values clarification exercise) and the study will examine the relative impact of the different features on decision quality. Eligible subjects will be randomly assigned to receive one of two decision aids before their upcoming clinic visit with a participating provider. Immediately before the visit, participants will complete a short questionnaire about the decision aid. This pilot study will assist with determining the potential difference between these two decision aids on improving knowledge and use of decision aids.

primary_outcome.measure: Hip and Knee Decision Quality Instruments Knowledge Subscale Scores
primary_outcome.time_frame: In clinic, immediately before the first visit with surgeon
primary_outcome.description: 5 multiple choice knowledge items from the Hip and Knee Decision Quality Instruments will be averaged into a knowledge subcale score (0-100%) with higher scores indicating higher knowledge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who used the Decision Aid
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In clinic, immediately before the first visit with surgeon
secondary_outcome.description: 1 item asking patients how much they reviewed the program (none, some. most, all). The percentage who report viewing most or all will be calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with a Clear Treatment Preference
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In clinic, immediately before the first visit with surgeon
secondary_outcome.description: 1 item assessing patient's treatment preference (surgery, non-surgical options, or not sure). The percentage who have a clear preference (either for surgery or non surgical options) will be calculated.

arm_group.description: Group receiving brief interactive decision aid. The decision aids are the Shared Decision Points for hip and knee osteoarthritis from Healthwise
Group receiving long video decision aids. The decision aids are the hip or knee DVD and Booklets for hip and knee osteoarthritis from Health Dialog

intervention.description: The Healthwise Shared Decision Points in booklet version for hip and knee osteoarthritis
Health Dialog DVD and booklet decision aids for hip and knee osteoarthritis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of either hip or knee osteoarthritis
- Scheduled visit with participating orthopedic surgeon
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior partial or total knee or hip replacement surgery
- Hip fracture or aseptic necrosis in the last 12 months
- Rheumatoid arthritis or psoriatic arthritis
- Unable to read or speak English

reference.citation: Sepucha K, Feibelmann S, Chang Y, Clay CF, Kearing SA, Tomek I, Yang T, Katz JN. Factors associated with the quality of patients' surgical decisions for treatment of hip and knee osteoarthritis. J Am Coll Surg. 2013 Oct;217(4):694-701. doi: 10.1016/j.jamcollsurg.2013.06.002.
